item.title: Intercomparison of aircraft and ground based measurements near major pollution sources over Taiwan (Ongoing)
item.description:
In this project, we focus on the pollutions near major sources over western Taiwan. Aircraft-based observation data are analyzed and compared with surface measurements to investigate near surface chemical reactions of pollutants. The preliminary result was presented in 18th ACC in Taipei in Dec. 2019.


Data used in this project:

  • Aircraft-baed observation
  • Ground-based measurements
  • Sounding and Lidar data
  • Reanalysis data

item.title: Tracer distribution simulation in western Taiwan using high resolution Taiwan Vector Vorticity Model (Ongoing)
item.description:
In this project, I analyzed simulation results and evaluated the impact on target regions, which usually have terrible air pollutions. In the next stage, we aim to applied zero and first-order chemical reactions into the model to inspect lifetime effect on the regions so as to understand the sources of the pollutant in those highly-polluted regions.


Data used in this project:

  • Taiwan Vector Vorticity Modeling results
  • Ground-based measurements

item.title: Quantitation of glucose using Cu₂O/Ag nanoparticles probe with a smartphone-controlled portable device
item.description:
A single-step method combining material preparation and the actual glucose measurements via the in situ growth of Cu2O/Ag nanoparticles was reported. Mechanistically, I use glucose itself to reduce Cu2+ and Ag+ ions that are stabilized with 3-mercaptopropionic acid and bovine serum albumin under alkaline conditions to form Cu2O/Ag nanoparticles and produce a color change in solution due to plasmonic resonance at 400 nm, which can be related back to the concentration of glucose. This was also the research of my master thesis.

In this project, a smartphone-controlled portable device was designed and carried out using Arduino system. The following figures show the relationships between each component in the device, the circuit and prototype of the device, and flow chart and images of the Android application to control the device.

item.title: Removing mercury ions from polluted solution through poly-dopamine-modified Fe₃O₄ nanoparticles
item.description: In this study, I improved the production efficiency of Fe3O4 nanoparticles by using a novel microwave synthesizer. Also, by modifying a poly-dopamine layer on the surface of nanoparticles to increase the surface area of nanoparticles, I succeeded in enlarging the Hg2+ ions adsorption capacity and releasing efficiency under hydrochloric acid of poly-dopamine-modified Fe3O4 nanoparticles and maintaining the high magnetic property of the material. The magnetic property of poly-dopamine-modified Fe3O4 nanoparticles makes it eco-friendly to reuse the material.
